Sr Software Engineer at GameStop
August 15, 2017, Mike worked with Jose in the same group

Mike and I worked for the CountryMedic.    It was our responsibility to cleanse medical data for each of the Dermatology Clinics.  I remember Mike was devoted to the project.  He would work many overtime hours in order to provide the fastest turn-around time between conversion iterations.    Mike was an excellent lead sharing his knowledge with the rest of the team.  During our iterations Mike would bring the team up to speed with innovative ways of making the process more efficient.  Mike also had keen sense of perception to provide insight during our "discovery meetings".  The meetings were designed to understand each clinic's data repository.  It was our responsibility to extract data from each of those repositories in an efficient manner.  Mike would often detect individual nuances  for the data extractions that would warrant extra attention.  Over all, Mike showed that he worked well leading a team, was well versed in the area of data extractions/integrations,  and provided insight with the technology of the time.  I recommend Mike for any and all positions in the area of Data Science.

I had the pleasure of working with Mike for 2 years and would recommend him to any organization who is looking for a utility player.  Mike has advanced knowledge of multiple programming languages and systems which gives him the ability to fully understand available options and system capabilities when gathering requirements from his customers and stakeholders.  because he has this knowledge, he is effective at building technical specifications for software developers to complete the projects accurately and timely. Mike is a team player and strives to not only get the job done above and beyond expectations, but he also has fun with the team while working on it.  Any organization he works with will be enhanced by him being a part of the team.

I have had the opportunity to work with Mike Anderson in the Digital Business Technology Team. In working with him on the Cerner Patient Portal called HealtheLife, he demonstrated a proficiency with clinical processes and systems. I also worked with Mike on projects that provided and an opportunity to inject more efficient processes into our team's daily tasks. In those projects, Mike used his SQL and Access Database skills he had acquired from other database and ETL work to provide an automated process that saved the team time on manual tasks.Mike would be a good asset to any team and he also had leadership skills. In past projects he isn't reserved on taking a lead role, organizing resources and determining what's needed to get the job done.

David is one the very best technical people I have had the pleasure to work with. Not only does he have a vast array of ETL knowledge and datatypes, but a keen ability to quickly grasp and then fully understand complex technical issues. There is no single aspect of IT that I would consider his forte, but rather he is that rare ‚Äújack of all trades, master of all trades‚Äù that makes David an asset in almost any situation. His ability to translate business needs into technical requirements is an enviable skill.He was key to helping our company get on ANSI x12 format ASAP.  He went way out of his way to ensure that we got great support A++I would recommend David to anyone that needs ETL, he is expert level.
